meanings.definition: In a stubborn or inflexible manner.
meanings.sent1: She held onto her beliefs obstinately, refusing to consider any other viewpoints.
meanings.sent2: He obstinately refused to budge from his position, no matter how much evidence was presented.
meanings.sent3: The cat obstinately sat in the middle of the doorway, blocking anyone from entering.
meanings.sent4: The old tree obstinately stood its ground against the strong winds, its roots firmly anchored in the soil.
meanings.sent5: The child obstinately insisted on wearing mismatched socks every day, much to the amusement of his classmates.

meanings.definition: Showing a refusal to change one's opinion or course of action.
meanings.sent1: Her obstinate behavior made it difficult to work with her on group projects.
meanings.sent2: The obstinate child refused to eat his vegetables, no matter how much his parents pleaded.
meanings.sent3: The obstinate door handle always got stuck, causing frustration for anyone trying to open it.
meanings.sent4: The obstinate old car refused to start on cold mornings, much to the annoyance of its owner.
meanings.sent5: The obstinate cat ignored all attempts to lure it inside, choosing to stay out in the rain obstinately.
